author: Mike Chandler
title: Magento 2 ada payments plugin
description: Currently, there are no plugins for ADA on the Magento marketplace. Over 170k websites use the Magento platform.

assessments.note: Generally, yes. I think the cointopay plugin may already be able to pay with ADA. An advantage here would be to create an app that is similar to a wallet to wallet payment and does not incur any extra fees (cointopay 1% extra). I am currently still missing these points.

While this is a potentially useful project, it is not as innovative as other proposals in this challenge and the effects are not as far-reaching. Those funds would be better spent on other projects within this challenge.

Draft proposal. The proposal is about creating a plugin to integrate the Magento marketplace and allow payments in ADA, in theory the concept could address the challenge, but there is no plan that indicates the alignment of the proposal and there are no goals / metrics that indicate the impact in the challenge. I recommend including a detailed plan according to the Catalyst documentation.

Availability of ADA payment plugins in Magento 2 will enable websites to use these and thereby improve the adoption of ADA as a means of payment. The proposal however has not included and technical details and had not brought out the steps involved in the execution of the process.

There are indeed 170k online shops built on Magento 2, so a plugin that would enable payments with Ada could indeed increase adoption of Cardano. But the proposal is very short, beyond this initial idea, there is not much info given, making it hard to assess.
Any payment integration could be beneficial to Cardano, but the proposal does not go into detail as to how this would be accomplished.
For someone with experience in the field, a plugin for Magento should be a manageable task. What I'm still missing is the connection and interface to the wallets.
no detailed plan or evidence of experience to enable success likelihood to be ascertained.

If i research the only information available about the proposer (mike chandler and the tag @webnettricks), all I am finding is some posts on stock trading (one of them is pushing AMZN stocks, just saying) and something that indicates the proposer working as a copyright agent (found on a webpage of some cell phone shop called phonebank). Nowhere about the competencies the proposer claims to have. Given that and the fact that no timeline or detailed plan for the proposal exists, it can be assessed that it's highly unlikely that it will be implemented.

Draft proposal. The details about the team are vague, there is mention of experience in the development of applications, but it would be important to provide more details, links to the team's Linkedin and the number of people involved in the development of the proposal.

There is no plan outlined in the proposal.

The lack of information makes it impossible to assess the feasibility of the proposal.
The proposer has claimed 10 years of experience in developing applications. However, no verifiable data has been provided to evaluate the capability of the team.

No experience details, the proposer only describes himself as having "built many applications for fortune 500 companies", yet no link is given and when asked about it in the comments, no answer was given. The plan is very basic, offering no details beyond the initial draft of the idea.

The proposers apparently have some development experience, but no technical outline or project roadmaps is given. The proposal lacks any substantive content.  This lack of effort in the proposal makes me doubt that the project will be successful.

One point is to create a plugin, another a successful plugin. I am missing some details in the technical description and a concept to not only create this plugin, but also to update it. For a billing plugin, security is a key factor and so I need to trust the developer.
Details required to enable the assessment of feasibility. Detailed plan with milestones and evidence of proposers capability.

The proposal is practically non-existent, it contains eight sentences. This goes nowhere near the quality criteria other proposals fulfill and contains no information about how the idea is going to be implemented or how the funds are going to be used. It was not possible to find any credible credentials for the proposer.
Draft proposal. There is no information to assess the auditability of the proposal.

The proposal has not listed the steps in creating the plugin and how they will be promoted for adaptation by the sites using Magento. The proposal only aims to create the plugin. The technical challenges in wallet integration and security have not be analyzed in the proposal.

There should be a clear explanation about what Magento2 is so that everyone understands the scope of the dApp. Afterwards, there should be a description of the plug-in, how it works, how you can buy it, what it can achieve. For a future re-submission, there should also be included a detailed budget, a roadmap, metrics, everything included in the self-assessment checklist.
No detail is given to understand how the funds will be utilized.

solution: Build a payment system that can be used on the Magento platform. We plan on building a plugin that any website on Magento can use.
experience: 20 years in business with 10 years developing applications, our developers have built many applications for fortune 500 companies.
